Opengear Cheat Sheet

published: 15th of December 2020

Intro

Opengear is a terminal server that is commonly used to connect to infrastructure devices via an out of band network or console/serial port.

This post covers some of the common commands and operations that I usually undertake with opengear devices.

Connecting

SSH to an opengear and open the serial menu.

cmd 
ssh <username>:serial@<ip-address>

Menu

Return to the serial menu.

On a new line press ~ . then enter

Links

https://opengear.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/216373723-What-escape-sequences-and-pmshell-menu-commands-are-available-inside-a-console-session-

https://www.thepacketwizard.com/blog/2017/07/17/open-gear-basic-commands/
